posts.post_content:
Definitely an excellent zombie. Overcosted? At 2BB, you cast this guy as early as turn 3, with another pump card like [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron), [Undead Warchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Warchief), and [Cemetery Reaper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cemetery Reaper), and just start blasting your opponents field for {B} per turn... In my zombie deck, anything you can't kill with this or [Nameless Inversion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nameless Inversion), you force your opponent to sacrifice with [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder) and [Call to the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to the Grave).  
  
At the very least, ~'s unusually high toughness for a zombie makes for a good blocker, which you can EOT destroy something on an opposing field. IMO, if you aren't playing this card, it's one of two things: Your playing a more aggro heavy build, or your doing it wrong.
posts.html:
Definitely an excellent zombie. Overcosted? At 2BB, you cast this guy as early as turn 3, with another pump card like Death Baron, Undead Warchief, and Cemetery Reaper, and just start blasting your opponents field for {B} per turn... In my zombie deck, anything you can't kill with this or Nameless Inversion, you force your opponent to sacrifice with Fleshbag Marauder and Call to the Grave.

At the very least, ~'s unusually high toughness for a zombie makes for a good blocker, which you can EOT destroy something on an opposing field. IMO, if you aren't playing this card, it's one of two things: Your playing a more aggro heavy build, or your doing it wrong.

Posted By: Omenchild (12/23/2009 12:17:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@CXA26483: You've got a very good point. In a Zombie deck, all those lords should be able to pump Unliving Psychopath to the extend that he can also take down larger threats easily. The relatively high toughness for a Zombie is also nice. At 4cc, you'd usually be casting something like [Death Baron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Baron) before him, leaving you with a handy 1/5 deathtouch blocker until you start using him offensively. Nameless Inversion can also pump him up in case you're in need of mana, so you might also be wise in running it in favor of [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) and whatnot.  
  
Also, another card that really makes this card good is [Undead Warchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Warchief). It solves all the problems with high manacost and low power that one may have. As CXA26483 said; either you're playing too aggressively to include this guy, or you're doing it wrong.
posts.html:
@CXA26483: You've got a very good point. In a Zombie deck, all those lords should be able to pump Unliving Psychopath to the extend that he can also take down larger threats easily. The relatively high toughness for a Zombie is also nice. At 4cc, you'd usually be casting something like Death Baron before him, leaving you with a handy 1/5 deathtouch blocker until you start using him offensively. Nameless Inversion can also pump him up in case you're in need of mana, so you might also be wise in running it in favor of Doom Blade and whatnot.

Also, another card that really makes this card good is Undead Warchief. It solves all the problems with high manacost and low power that one may have. As CXA26483 said; either you're playing too aggressively to include this guy, or you're doing it wrong.

posts.post_content: I think what makes this guy pretty good is his ability to pick off utility creatures. Yes, he's expensive to get out, but still, any creature that hits the field after he shows up he can pick off if they're weak enough (and if you get him out quick enough in various ways, it's not as bad). Give him some other kinds of pump and you got yourself a pretty useful creature.

posts.post_content:
I just tried this guy out for the first time and he served me very well in a multiplayer match.   
The 4 toughness kept casual attacks away and when I stuck a [Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter) on him people couldn't  
reach for their removal fast enough.   
I consider anything that buys me that much time and wastes so much of my opponent's resources is a good deal.
